summary: Determines whether a string contains another string within itself.
description:
Characters in a string are indexed from left to right.
The index of the first character is 0, and the index of the last character of a string called stringName is stringName.length - 1.
The string search is case-sensitive.

dataPorts.From Index:
an integer representing the index at which to start the search. The default value is 0.
For From Index values lower than 0 or greater than Input String length, the search starts at index 0 and Input String length respectively.
dataPorts.Found Index:
the index of the first occurence of Searched String or -1 if not found.
An empty string Searched String will match at any index between 0 and Input String length.

controlPorts.True: is activated if the <doc-idp-name translate=no>Input String</doc-idp-name> string value contains the <doc-idp-name translate=no>Searched String</doc-idp-name> searched string value.
controlPorts.False: is activated if the <doc-idp-name translate=no>Input String</doc-idp-name> string value does not contain the <doc-idp-name translate=no>Searched String</doc-idp-name> searched string value.
